Name Tag

Practice using CSS to style HTML.

  1. In the CSS box, update the .tag rule set to include a background-color declaration. Set the background color to #cc0000
  2. In the CSS box, create a rule set with the selector .tag-h2. Add declarations to the rule set so that the text color is white, the font size is 2.5rem, the text is centered, the text-transform is uppercase.
  3. In the CSS box, create a rule set that targets the <h3> tag. Add declarations to the rule set that makes the text centered, white, and unbolded.
  4. In the HTML box, add your name to the <h1> tag.
  5. In the CSS box, update the .tag-h1 rule set to include a background-color declaration. Set the background color to white. Update the font and text to make your name standout.
